page.title: 02The Chesterfield Canal
page.content: The{Chesterfield Canal,}which crosses our block from east to west,was built in{1777}by{James Brindley.}It was closed in{1908}because the{Norwood {tunnel}fell in and stopped boats from going through our block.The canal runs along side the railway.The canal ran from{Chesterfield}to the{River {Trent.}It runs through the hamlet of {Turnerwood}which was built at the same time as the canal.The canal was built to get brick,stone and coal from {Chesterfield}to the{River Trent.}The canal towpath is used for nice long walks.The canal is full of reeds and some people are trying to re-open it to let boats through our block.The main problem of re-opening the canal is that they would have to put gates on all the locks.The canal is 7 feet wide at the locks.The locks are in ruins.
